newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian rubber prices down at noon.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian rubber prices down at noon.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices were quoted down at noon, following an absence of buying interest, traders said.

At midday, the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board priced the benchmark May RSS1 buyer at 288.50 cents ($1.15) a kg, down one cent from Wednesday's close. May SMR20 buyer was also quoted a cent down at 271 cents a kg.
"The market's absolutely dull," said a trader. "There's no buying interest at all."
Dealers could not report of any inquiries since morning.
An official trade source said checks with trading houses showed that most of their clients either had ample stocks or were short-covering in small quantities.
At noon, trading houses offered the SMR 20 at 271 cents a kg, SMR CV at 342, SMR L at 322, SMR 5 at 282, SMR 10 at 272 and drum latex FOB at 231.
